summary.para: Creates an object for copying spatial audio metadata items from one object to another.

param.name: metadataCopier
param.para: Receives a pointer to an instance of .

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

description.para: The provided pointer is not valid.

summary.para: Creates an object for storing spatial audio metadata items.

param.name: maxItemCount
param.para: The maximum number of metadata items that can be stored in the returned .

param.name: frameCount
param.para: The valid range of frame offset positions for metadata items stored in the returned .

param.name: metadataItemsBuffer
param.para: If a pointer is supplied, returns an interface which provides methods for attaching caller-provided memory for storage of metadata items. If this parameter is NULL, the object will allocate internal storage for the items. This interface cannot be obtained via .

param.name: metadataItems
param.para: Receives an instance object which can be populated with metadata items using an by or and can be read with an .

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

description.para: The pointer provided in the metadataItems parameter is not valid.
The value of maxItemCount or frameCount is 0.

summary.para: Creates an object for reading spatial audio metadata items from an object.

param.name: metadataReader
param.para: Receives a pointer to an instance of .

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

description.para: The provided pointer is not valid.

summary.para: Creates an object for writing spatial audio metadata items to an object.

param.name: overflowMode
param.para: A value that specifies the behavior when attempting to write more metadata items to the than the maximum number of items specified when calling .

param.name: metadataWriter
param.para: Receives a pointer to an instance of .

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

description.para: The provided pointer is not valid.

summary.para: Gets the length of the buffer required to store the specified number of spatial audio metadata items. Use this method to determine the correct buffer size to use when attaching caller-provided memory through the interface.

param.name: maxItemCount
param.para: The maximum number of metadata items to be stored in an object.

param.name: bufferLength
param.para: The length of the buffer required to store the number of spatial audio metadata items specified in the maxItemCount parameter.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

description.para: The provided pointer is not valid.
The value of maxItemCount or frameCount is 0.

summary.para: Provides a class factory for creating , , , and objects. When an ISpatialAudioMetadataItems is activated, a metadata format ID is specified, which defines the metadata format enforced for all objects created from this factory. If the specified format is not supported by the current audio render endpoint, the class factory will not successfully activate the interface and will return an error.
This interface is a part of Windows Sonic, Microsoft’s audio platform for more immersive audio which includes integrated spatial sound on Xbox and Windows.
